feed.title: SAP Community - User Interface
feed.subtitle: User Interface Q&A in SAP Community

entry.title: reset user password through command line
entry.content:
Hello,

My SAP server works on windows and using S4/Hana DB and I'm trying to reset user's password through command line.

I've found that it is possible by using R3trans command and prepared password_reset.txt file as below;

export
client=400
user=username
password=123456

and run this command;

R3trans -w password_reset.log password_reset.txt

but it gives me this output

4 ETW000 R3trans version 6.26 (release 777 - 19.06.24 - 15:07:06).
4 ETW000 unicode enabled version
4 ETW000 ===============================================
4 ETW000 
4 ETW000 date&time   : 06.12.2024 - 13:31:45
4 ETW000 control file: password_reset.txt
4 ETW000 > export
4 ETW000 > client=400
4 ETW000 > user=SONERCTEST
4 ETW000 > password=123456
4 ETW000 R3trans was called as follows: R3trans -w password_reset.log password_reset.txt
3WETW000 obsolete R3trans option ignored: USER=SONERCTEST (line 3).
4 ETW000 
2EETW000 error when reading the R3trans controlfile
2EETW000 unknown option PASSWORD = yes at line 4, symbol "=".
2EETW000 error when reading the R3trans controlfile
2EETW000 syntax error at line 4, symbol "123456".

What am i doing wrong here?

entry.title: Using Links to execute UI rules
entry.content:
Hi experts

I have UI built for  custom MDF, that is used in Onboarding Personal Data Collection.

I'm attempting to add a link. There are two types: "Open URL" and "Execute UI Rules". The "open URL" ones work fine, but the links I have added to execute a UI rules don't seem to trigger. I wonder if these type of inks are supported in ONB? 

Thanks

entry.title: Edit button not grayed out in edit mode
entry.content:
Hello,

When the search action is performed, the edit action is triggered as well. The issue I'm facing is that the Edit button remains active (not grayed out), which makes it unclear to the user whether they are in edit mode or not.

In the standard version of the app, this behavior seems to be handled correctly. Unfortunately, I don't have access to the standard app to compare the implementation and identify what might be missing.

Do you have any idea how to control the button state appropriately?

Thanks in advance,
George

entry.title: Drop Down Box Entry Removal
entry.content: Is there a way to remove selections from a drop down box? ECC 6.0 will add manual entries to the drop-down box and they will stay until there have been enough entries after that to knock it off the list. If I enter a typo in a field where there should only ever be one entry, like the Z below, it will stay there indefinitely, and I have to click around it each time I want to choose the correct entry of Z1. It gets inconvenient pretty quickly when doing these changes en masse. Thanks for any tips!

However some UDF were created with ValidRules, but when I check the odata from UserFieldsMD those rules do not appear, so I don't know how to implement them in another company without creating a TransactionNotification block or entering the GUI to manually change it.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

We're using SAP Business One for HANA, version 10.0 (10.00.190) FP 2202

Any ideas?

entry.title: Error on Logout event from SAP Build Work Zone in SAPUI5 page
entry.content:
I am trying to attach a callback to the Logout event from the SAP Build Work Zone in my SAPUI5 application, to then request a logout in my approuter application. This is the logic I added to enable the event:

// UI5 Component
export default class Component extends UIComponent {
	//...
	public init(): void {
		//...

		// Log out when the user clicks the logout button in the shell header (BWZ)
		Container.attachLogoutEvent(() => {
			console.log("Logout event triggered, redirecting to logout endpoint.");
			window.location.replace('/do/logout');
		}, false)
	}
}

 The callback is working on my local tests, and I can see the log message on the console. However, when I try to do same thing inside our SAP Build Work Zone subscription, the callback doesn't run and we see a error message:

 After investigating the source files I notices this error happens when the Logout Event is being created and a deprecated part of the code executes. I wasn't able to find any configurations on SAP Build Work Zone that would fix it, but I might have missed something?

Has anyone else seen this error before? How can I contact the SAP Build Work Zone team to get support?

Thanks

entry.title: User Type FW is Not Active in SAP?
entry.content:
User Type FW is Not Active Error 

When we try to create a reference user or copy an existing user using SU01 t-code in SAP then we face the error message: User Type FW is not active in SAP. 

This error comes when the user you are copying is of type FW (Workflow System User), and in your system, this user type is not yet activated or supported because the workflow configuration is incomplete. 

In my case, we faced this issue specifically with user type FW but in your case the user type may be different. So it’s important to first identify your user type. 

How to Check and Activate Missing User Types using USMM T-Code.

  1. First Run the T-code USMM in the SAP GUI. 
  2. Then Click on the User Types tab. 

 

       3. Select and activate the missing user type FW or any other that's required. 

       4. Save your changes. 

Now try to create or copy the reference user again. If the error persists feel free to reach out or comment below if I can help resolve your issue I definitely will!

NOTE: I had to add tags to this post and chose the closest ones.

entry.title: Why do many power users still prefer SAP GUI over Fiori in S/4HANA?
entry.content:
SAP learner here 👋

As I dig deeper into S/4HANA UX, I keep running into a pattern: even in organizations with a well-set-up Fiori Launchpad, a lot of experienced users still default to SAP GUI. I’m not trying to start a GUI vs. Fiori war—genuinely curious about the practical reasons behind this and what has worked to shift habits

I am looking answers for the following topics: 

  • A concrete task where GUI wins (e.g., “Display/Change X,” “High-volume posting,” “Mass edits”).

  • Why Fiori fell short (speed? feature gap? layout? navigation?)

  • Workarounds or fixes you’ve tried

  • If you’ve successfully moved teams to Fiori, what made the real difference? 

  • Which roles experience the biggest benefits with a switch from GUI to FIORI? Which Roles generally prefer to stay in GUI?

entry.title: After executing the data action, the manually entered parameter values remain cached for the session
entry.content:
Hi,

We’re working with a scenario where a data action prompt is prefilled based on table selection. The input controls are dynamically assigned via script according to the selected table row. This setup works well—as long as the user doesn’t manually change the prompt values.

However, once a user manually modifies the parameter values in the data action prompt (f.e. different cost center) and executes the action, those manually entered values persist for the session. After that, the prompt no longer reflects updates from the input controls, even though the script continues assigning the correct values.

While resetting the story via Edit > Reset resolves the issue, it’s not a viable option due to long loading times.

Could you please confirm if this is a known behavior? And is there any recommended workaround—ideally one that doesn’t require rebuilding the prompt dialog from scratch?

Many thanks,
Fabian

entry.title: LMS UI Inconsistency Between TEST and Production Environments (Button + Font)
entry.content:
Dear SAP SuccessFactors Support Team & Community, 

I am currently experiencing a discrepancy between the TEST and Production environments within the LMS module, and I would appreciate your assistance.

Specifically, I’ve noticed differences in button color and font styling between the two environments:

  • Production environment: Displays a blue button (highlighted in orange in the screen1) and a specific font style (highlighted in green in the screen1).

  • TEST environment: Displays an orange button (highlighted in orangein the screen2) and a different font style (highlighted in green in the screen2).

I’ve attached two screenshots to illustrate the issue.

Despite my efforts, I have not been able to locate any documentation explaining how to align these UI elements across environments. Could you please advise on how to achieve a consistent look and feel?

Thank you in advance for your support.
